critique: The document establishes a Transition Planning Office within the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) to coordinate and guide transition planning throughout the executive branch in preparation for the establishment of the Department of Homeland Security. It ensures that existing authorities of United States Government departments and agencies are not altered and directs all executive departments and agencies to assist the Director for Transition Planning and the Transition Planning Office. The order terminates within 90 days after the enactment of legislation creating the Department of Homeland Security or within 1 year of the order's date, whichever occurs first.
